intro: Malvastrum clementinum, commonly known as the showy milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant pink to red flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Malvastrum clementinum is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
